header.name: Vova Zakharov
header.tagline: Developer – AI, full-stack, and the bits in-between

profile.title: Profile
profile.paragraph1: Developer with a physics-and-math brain and a knack for building practical tools that turn AI buzz into actual features. Ever since 2019, most of my work revolves around LLMs and image generation, following years of messing with smaller neural networks. This means I don't buy or sell buzzwords, I understand things a level or two deeper than most, and I've developed an intuition for what models can and cannot do.
profile.paragraph2: I've built systems from scratch, simplified convoluted integrations, and turned vague ideas into working prototypes — across open-source, startups, and global advertising giants.

coreCapabilities.title: Core Capabilities
coreCapabilities.item1: Bring your idea to an MVP/prototype in 1-2 months
coreCapabilities.item2: Clean the mess in the prototype you vibe-coded
coreCapabilities.item3: Explain exactly why your AI agent doesn't work the way you expected, and fix it

workingStyle.title: Working Style
workingStyle.paragraph1: I'm the kind of developer you can generally leave unattended, as long as the overall vector is clear. I have enough life expertise to figure stuff on my own, enough imagination to fill the missing pieces, and a "treat any job as if it was your own brainchild" mentality.
workingStyle.paragraph2: In other words: a surprisingly low-maintenance LLM tinkerer with a TypeScript kink, ready to prototype, debug, or sanity-check your AI-infused ambitions.

aiExpertise.title: AI Expertise
aiExpertise.paragraph: I tend to stick to a more "economical" paradigm of AI usage: smaller prompts, more aware of context limitations, less "let's feed it all and it'll somehow work!" My expertise predates the ChatGPT hype cycle, which means I understand not just the APIs, but the underlying patterns and limitations that most "AI engineers" are still discovering.

project1.title: Developer – Project Work
project1.description: AI-powered English learning application for kids, combining generative AI with time-tested pedagogical methodology to make language acquisition engaging and effective.
items: Interactive game-based learning experiences powered by LLM-generated content.
Adaptive difficulty and personalized learning paths based on individual progress.
Integration of proven teaching methods with modern AI capabilities.
project1.tech: Next.js, OpenAI API, custom game engine

project2.title: Developer – Project Work
project2.description: Short-term project shaping an AI-agent–based review intelligence tool for brand marketing.
items: Automated review collection from diverse public sources.
AI-driven summarization with structured outputs (SWOT, competitive positioning, feature insights).
Early productization steps toward a scalable SaaS-style platform.
project2.tech: Next.js/NestJS, Cloudflare Workers, Firebase, custom LLM orchestration framework

randddb.title: Developer
randddb.description: Experimental AI platform at one of the world's largest ad firms. Built, back to front, a suite of interlinked AI tools:

items.label: Chatbot:
items.text: ChatGPT-style assistant for corporate needs — secure, document-aware, image-savvy, with personas and real-time multi-user support.

items.label: Robowriter:
items.text: Build-your-own-agent tool for content generation. Functions as both user-facing product and meta-backend for LLM ops.

items.label: Picmaker:
items.text: Replicate-powered image generation/training tool with UX optimized for rapid iteration and intuitive pinning.

items.label: Client-specific apps:
items.text: Including YesYouCannes, which builds Cannes award decks from idea to imagery in minutes.

items.label: Spaces:
items.text: White-label mini-platforms for agency clients (e.g. randddb.com/s/ikea).

randddb.tech: Django + PostgreSQL backend, Vue + TypeScript frontend

items.label: Jukebox Web UI:
items.text: Gradio-based UI running inside Google Colab for OpenAI's music model.

items.label: almostmagic:
items.text: Python package for instant LLM integration – one line, zero ceremony.

items.label: JobGenie:
items.text: AI assistant for job seekers that helps create roles as much as apply for them.

items.label: Flows:
items.text: A Django app for orchestrating async task pipelines with minimal ceremony.

items.label: Unfindables:
items.text: An experiment in surfacing valuable but hidden web content via absurd search queries.

voicemod.title: Prototyper – Experience & Innovation
voicemod.description: Prototyped bleeding-edge tools for audio + AI experimentation.
items: Built a YAML-powered Discord bot framework for zero-code bot creation.
Developed a local Python web API with a ChatGPT-style interface.

items.label: Django / FastAPI
items.text: – If you rely on your own ML models or otherwise require computations/libs that the JavaScript world hasn't yet caught up with

items.label: Next.js API
items.text: – If you're mostly using other people's web APIs and don't want to go all fancy and domain-driven

items.label: NestJS
items.text: – If you do want to go all fancy and domain-driven

items.label: Next.js / React
items.text: – If you want to stay on the safe and "we can definitely hire another dev to work with it later" side

items.label: Nuxt / Vue
items.text: – If you're feeling all progressive and SFC-ish

items.label: Cloudflare Workers
items.text: – Because why not rely on something that can make the entire Internet stop a few times a year?

items.label: Google Colab
items.text: — Had my fair share of fails and successes building and testing models

items.label: Gradio
items.text: – Quick but powerful UIs for ML experiments

education.title: Education
education.school: Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology
